choices.A: The counter variable of the For Each activity is global, so any change to it in the enclosed scope activity is retained and that change can impact the next iteration.
choices.C: The For Each activity waits for the execution to finish for all the branches specified when the completion condition is specified and evaluated to true.
choices.B: The For Each activity executes a contained scope activity N times, where N is the final counter value minus the starting counter value.
choices.D: The counter variable of a For Each activity is local to the enclosed scope activity, so a change to it outside the scope of the For Each, does not impact the next

discussion.content: D. The counter variable of a For Each activity is local to the enclosed scope activity, so a change to it outside the scope of the For Each, does not impact the next
D. The counter variable of a For Each activity is local to the enclosed scope activity, so a change to it outside the scope of the For Each, does not impact the next

questions.question_text: For each three items can you create tests by using the Service Component Architecture (SCA) test framework?

choices.D: Skip all subsequent routing and mark a task as complete.
choices.A: Load balance tasks among users based upon server utilization.
choices.B: Redirect the process flow as specified in the PBMN model.

discussion.content:
B. Redirect the process flow as specified in the PBMN model.
C. Escalate and reassign a task to the manager of the current assignee

C. Escalate and reassign a task to the manager of the current assignee.
D. Skip all subsequent routing and mark a task as complete.

questions.question_text: Which two are objectives that you can achieve by using business rules to direct human workflow?

discussion.content:
A. On the client side, the agent coordinates a pipeline of policy interceptors that apply policy assertions to a request in a standardized, predetermined order.
B. On the service side, policy assertions are processed in reverse order of the client side before a request is delivered to the service.

choices.C: On the client side, the policy manager coordinates a pipeline of agents that apply policy assertions to the request in the order specified by the developer.
choices.D: On the service side, policy assertions are processed in the same order as on the client side before a request is delivered to the service.
choices.B: On the service side, policy assertions are processed in reverse order of the client side before a request is delivered to the service.
choices.A: On the client side, the agent coordinates a pipeline of policy interceptors that apply policy assertions to a request in a standardized, predetermined order.

questions.question_text: Which two statements accurately describe how Oracle Web Services Manager works?

discussion.content:
C. When you use JDeveloper to associate a security policy with a web service, the policy is not really attached until application deployment.
D. OWSM policies can be attached and detached with WLST.

questions.question_text: Identify two statements that correctly describe OWSM policy attachments in Oracle SOA Suite

choices.D: OWSM policies can be attached and detached with WLST.
choices.C: When you use JDeveloper to associate a security policy with a web service, the policy is not really attached until application deployment.
choices.A: Although you can attach as well as detach security policies in JDeveloper, you can only detach them in Enterprise Manager.
choices.B: An application developer typically uses JDeveloper to create new security policies rather than select them from a prebuilt list.
